reviewText: Absolutely love this movie, Peter O'Toole is just wonderful. This movie is a pleasure to watch some great laughs and some teary moments (sure I have gotten a little sappy in my older years).  But have to say this is probably the best roll that Vincent Spano has had and haven't  really seen much of Muriel Hemingway after this movie. The movie was great when it first released and it still is and would watch again.
summary: The Big Picture of a wonderful movie

Title: N/A

reviewText: What is the big picture? Well, you have to see the movie to understand what I'm talking about. Personally, I think I get the big picture and that's why I love this movie so much.Peter O'Toole is great in this. So are Vincent Spano, Virginia Madsen, Mariel Hemingway, and David Ogden Stiers.What can I say about this story? It's sometimes hard for me to explain it to people who haven't seen it. When some people hear "a man tries to regrow his dead wife" they sort of cringe and think it's some sort of weird sci fi or horror movie.It's neither - it's a love story. Actually, it's several love stories. You've got the love Harry has for his late wife, the love between him and Millie, the love between Boris and Barbara, and even the love (non-romantic) between Boris and Harry.Still, Creator is far from a typical "love story." It's very unique. I've never seen another movie quite like it.It's got a great cast and great story with a nice mix of humor, drama, and romance. If you haven't seen it, you should give it a try.If you're the sort of person who gets "the big picture," you'll probably end up liking this movie a lot.
summary: If you get the big picture, you'll love this movie

reviewText: Peter O'Toole is one of my favorite actors & this is (I think) his best movie.  In my mind, it is the greatest movie that nobody has ever heard of.It is a tale about a doctor (O'Toole) who wants to clone  his dead wife.  However, the movie is about a lot more than that.  He and  his graduate assistant learn about love, friendship and the "big  picture."  It is kind of a cross between a drama and a comedy.  Quite  a deep movie that will make you laugh and leave you in tears as the final  credits roll up the screen.  Anyone who likes either Peter O'Toole or great  intellectual movies (or both) will love  this one.  A fine flick!

reviewText: Characters so open, intelligent and definitely seeking happiness.  It is a bit of a jolt to watch because movies like this are not made any longer.  Cynicism and collectivism reign.  If you have a happy and hopeful sense of life, you will love it.

reviewText: So happy to see this on Instant video - maybe it will encourage more people to watch it.  I have loved this movie since seeing it as a teenager years ago.  It's just perfect - wonderful acting, unique story, fully-human characters, believable relationships, and an emotionally satisfying roller coaster.  I can't believe this isn't considered one of the best dramas ever made.  Watch it - you won't regret it.
summary: One of my top 5 favorites, ever!

reviewText: A  genius ("nutty") professor wants to clone his dead wife after 30 years.  Enter a 19 year old living nymphomaniac, full of life and natural wisdom, and imagine  the results.  This stars Peter O'Toole, Mariel Hemingway, Vincent Spano. a very young (and, as always, lovely) Virginia Madsen,  David Ogden Stiers, andJohn Dehner.  Written by Jeremy Levin (based on his novel) and directed by Ivan Passer, this is a sweet ,small film that is rather predictable, but benign and "feel good."  It raises some large philosophical issues but don't let that frighten you (it never gets very deep).  Everyone  in it is good so it's a nice film for a lazy afternoon.  My only negative issue is that this particular DVD was full screen and I keep wondering who these philistines are who keep issuing widescreen movies in full screen format.

reviewText: This has got to be one of the best kept secrets of modern films.  I believe it was a HBO movie and never played in the theaters, but don't let this discourage you from seeing it.  This is a warm, intellectually slapstick and romantic comedy that will touch you in ways no other film can.  With innocence and joy, it captures one of the most beautiful love scenes I have ever seen on screen.  Peter O'Toole is wonderful.  One of his best scenes was when O'Toole (having no lines), walks along the beach with his young assistant after the death of the boy's father.  I could say more, but there's no need.  The reviews speak for themselves.  This is a keeper.  Oh! Keep an eye open for Opie's dad.  Do you believe in life on other planets?  Very cute!
summary: Most People Grow Tomatoes, Not Harry Wolper!

reviewText: This movie is an understated gem of a film!! Start to finish, there is always something to make you grin. The performances are very good from all the players, and the dialogue is rich & very witty. Even the plot is quite unique, especially given the era the movie was made in. The central romances of the film--Harry/Meli and Boris/Barbara--are sweet & touching. There is good chemistry shared by all. This film is worth watching!!!

reviewText: Peter O'Toole's best work to date. Ms Hemingway was excellent in this film despite the fact that it was one her first starring roles ('Lipstick' may have been filmed first). This movie will bring happy tears to your eyes... It is an incredible story about a Scientist who wishes to clone his dead wife and his relationship with the woman who volunteers to help him do so. This and 'The Doctor' are classics and must see - must have in your library or collection of art/films. I always recommend buying TWO of the classics so you can share or loan one to others. You WILL want to share it...
summary: A Touching Story About Unexpected Love

reviewText: I can't imagine Peter O'Toole in anything but spectacular. He is truly a cultured individual and thespian."Creator" has everything good that you would want in a film: writing, plot, acting, music. For me, the perfect film makes you laugh, makes you cry, provokes thought, and has the ending you want - and "Creator" has it all.It's a pure fantasy, but a believable fantasy that one day soon might become a reality. I won't give away the plot, as other reviews have most likely given away the whole story, so just know that if you are a person with feelings, you will love this film!

reviewText: I love this movie, but I HATE, HATE, HATE this DVD.  It is the worst transfer I have ever seen on a DVD.  It is full screen, but the pan and scan is terrible.  You lose about 50 percent of the image from the VHS version.  There are scenes where you can't even see the people talking in the scene because they are on the extreme right and left.  You are left looking at a mostly empty room.  Do yourself a favor and don't buy this DVD.  If they ever release it on a widescreen, I'll buy it...but until then don't make the same mistake I did.

reviewText: This movie has flaws (BIOLOGISTS calling a chimp a MONKEY (!!), supposedly having "hospital privileges" and treating medical patients (!!), obviously written by someone who hadn't a clue about such things) but I'm nitpicking, because its heart is SO in the right place it's worth watching.  One quibble though, without ruining the plot, WHAT happened to the "science project" O'Toole had hidden beneath the sheet in his home lab?  No explanation was given as to what became of it.  And, while profanity doesn't bother me, for those it does, there's lots of it, explicit sex and sexual discussions, too, so not suitable for the kids (though ultimately the film is respectful of religion and religious values, e.g., the sanctity of marriage).The casting was inspired, spot on.  I'm a big Peter O'Toole fan (one of my favorite movies ever isDEAN SPANLEY), but even so, in CREATOR I thought a young Vincent Spano (followed closely by Mariel Hemingway) just MADE the movie, its heart and soul.  He's charming, sincere, totally believable- captivating in scene after scene, the ones in the hospital towards the end are something to behold- affecting, moving.  I also liked the relationship between O'Toole and Hemingway, real chemistry there, ditto with O'Toole and Spano, and Spano and Virginia Madsen.  And Lee Kessler shone in a little gem of a performance as Mrs. Pruitt, O'Toole's gal friday.  The film is visually pleasing, beautifully shot, gorgeous scenery.  VERY quirky, schmaltzy, but most definitely a feel-good movie and a fine way to spend a couple hours.
summary: GREAT casting, & Vincent Spano MAKES the movie,*FOR ADULTS ONLY*
